A Truly Wonderful Hotel Experience

I had an absolutely fantastic stay at this hotel. From the moment I arrived, the staff made me feel genuinely welcome. Their friendliness and attention to detail were truly outstanding—they went above and beyond to ensure I was comfortable and had everything I needed.

The room was immaculate, beautifully decorated, and offered all the comforts of home and more. I especially appreciated the quiet atmosphere, the quality of the bed and linens, and the little touches like complimentary water and toiletries.

The hotel's location was perfect.

Overall, this hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a warm, welcoming, and top-notch place to stay. I’ll definitely be returning!

text.text:
Excellent Stay with Exceptional Hospitality!

We recently stayed at this hotel and had a fantastic experience. The staff was incredibly helpful and always available whenever we needed assistance. Their hospitality made our stay even more comfortable.

While the hotel doesn’t have an in-house restaurant, they seamlessly arrange food from nearby restaurants, and you can also use online food delivery services without any hassle. This was very convenient for us.

The location is another highlight—it’s close to the railway station and many local tourist spots, making it an ideal place for travelers exploring Chennai. The rooms were spotless, well-maintained, and very comfortable, ensuring a pleasant stay.

Additionally, they offer tour package arrangements, which is a great option for those wanting to explore the city with ease.

Overall, our stay was wonderful, and we highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chennai!

text.text:
I booked a room at this hotel through an online website. Just before the booking date, I received a WhatsApp message claiming to be from Raj Park, asking for my bank details. Shockingly, the message contained all my booking information. This means either the data was leaked or hacked. When I called the hotel, they acknowledged being aware of such scams and said their team was working on it. If they knew about this, they should have at least notified guests in advance to ignore such messages, which they failed to do.

Coming to the stay, the first room we were given had a terrible odor, and we had to request a room change. The second room was better, but even there, the bathroom light was fused. By then, we were so disappointed that we didn’t bother asking for another change.

In one word—avoid this hotel. For the same price, you can easily find much better options. Truly disappointing experience.

text.text:
Had a terrible experience at Hotel Raj Park Chennai due to the unprofessional behaviour exhibited by the staff. Staff members seemed uninterested in assisting customers. The reception staff were totally lost when I asked a simple question about the check out timing.

Restaurant staff behaviour was an epitome of unprofessionalism The food was served cold, as though it had just been taken out of the refrigerator. It was clear that it hadn't been properly heated before being plated. I expected a warm, freshly made meal, but instead, I got something that felt like it had been sitting around for far too long. Which when mentioned to the staff they agreed to it without showing any regret.

Key card was not functioning at times, making it difficult to access my room. I had to go back to the front desk each time to get a new card or have it reprogrammed, which became time-consuming and inconvenient. Although the receptionist attended to the issue,  the card was not reprogrammed properly, have to visit reception for the second time due to this issue.

It’s clear that customer satisfaction is not a priority here. I was expecting a much higher level of professionalism. Sadly, I won’t be returning and would not recommend this place to anyone looking for a positive experience.

text.text:
We hired 2 rooms for 3 nights.

The superior rooms are very good, hotel interiors and ambience is nice, food was great and customer service was excellent. Loved the breakfast buffet!

Minuses

- Smelly towels
- erratic, fluctuating AC
- room intercom phone was not working

We paid over 30k for our 3 day stay  but was charged Rs 500 to replace a lost room key card.

I’ve stayed in many high end hotels and they give a replacement card At no charge.

If the bill is above a certain amount, replacement key should be given free - it’s not a big deal to give one.

Two days back my friend and I stayed here for a day. We found it very comfortable and clean. All the hotel staff were cooperative. We checked out of the hotel next day morning and as our return journey was only around 11 pm in the night, we had planned sightseeing till night. The hotel staff were so accommodative that they kept our luggage safe after we checked out and later in the night they gave us a room for half an hour to freshen up after the sightseeing.
I would recommend this hotel for a clean and comfortable stay.
The only problem was that it was not on the main road, but it was still in Chennai central.

editorialSummary.text: Simply furnished rooms, some with safes, in an unassuming hotel providing Wi-Fi & parking.

text.text:
I stayed at this hotel recently and honestly, it was not a pleasant experience. The rooms were very small and felt quite suffocating. There was barely enough space to move or keep luggage comfortably. The most disappointing part was the condition of the floors — they were sticky and felt unclean, which made it very uncomfortable to walk around, even with slippers.

Housekeeping was just average, but the cleaning felt rushed and not thorough. Basic cleanliness and hygiene should be a priority, especially in hospitality, but it was clearly lacking here.

The room also had a weird damp smell that didn’t go away, and the overall ambiance was dull. The photos online were quite misleading compared to what was actually offered. Even the bed linens didn’t feel fresh or properly washed.

Honestly, I wouldn’t recommend this place unless the management takes serious steps to improve hygiene and overall upkeep.

text.text:
I had a wonderful experience staying at The Grand One Hotel. The location is extremely convenient, especially for those visiting Apollo Hospital, as it’s just a short walk away. The rooms were spotlessly clean, well-maintained, and equipped with all the basic amenities needed for a comfortable stay.

What truly stood out was the hospitality of the staff—they were polite, helpful, and always ready to assist with a smile. The check-in process was smooth, and housekeeping was prompt and efficient. Even though the hotel doesn’t have an in-house restaurant, room service was available and there were plenty of dining options nearby.

The hotel also offers free Wi-Fi, 24-hour front desk support, and ample parking space, which added to the convenience. I would highly recommend The Grand One to anyone looking for a clean, budget-friendly, and centrally located stay in Chennai.

text.text:
We had the pleasure of staying at Grand One Tower – a true Business Class Hotel in Chennai – not just once, but three times last year, and every time felt like a home away from home.

Their 24×7 check-in and check-out facility is a huge advantage, especially for travellers with unpredictable schedules. But what made our experience truly memorable was the warmth, efficiency, and attentiveness of the entire team.

Special thanks to Mr. Zakariya at the reception – always professional, welcoming, kind and very helpful. And a big appreciation for Juel from housekeeping – always polite and ready to assist. He always promptly brought our online food orders to the room with a smile – truly commendable service.

We opted for a room with a kitchen, which made our stay even more convenient. The kitchen had almost all the basic utensils – even a Mortar and Pestle (Hamandista), which was a thoughtful addition. However, one thing that was missing was a Vessel Holder (Sarashi). Including that would make the kitchen setup even more complete.

In the room all basic amenities were well provided, and the daily housekeeping service kept everything clean and comfortable. We especially appreciated that anything we needed was just a phone call away – the reception team responded immediately.

We noticed that only on some floors had the refrigerator outside at one corner of the floor. So, we specifically chose our room based on the fridge placement and the staff kindly accommodated our preferences.

A small suggestion: the bathroom tiles in the shower area get a bit slippery when wet, although it’s limited to just that section and not the entire bathroom. It would be great if this could be addressed to enhance safety.
Also, the exhaust fan feels slightly underpowered for the bathroom size.

Even though this is a late review, the hospitality and comfort we experienced are still fresh in our minds. We’re already planning to stay at Grand One Tower again on our next visit to Chennai.

A well-managed, peaceful and guest-friendly Business Class Hotel – highly recommended!

text.text:
I had a reservation at Hotel Pandian, Chennai, but there was a mistake with the date. Thankfully, the front desk staff were very helpful and corrected the issue quickly. I was allotted a room without much delay, which I really appreciate.

The hotel is a good budget option in the heart of Chennai. The location is convenient and the staff are courteous.

However, maintenance could be improved—a few things in the room felt dated or not well-kept. Also, the complimentary breakfast was disappointing and didn’t feel worth the price. Better quality or more variety would improve the overall experience.

Still, for the price, it’s a decent stay for short visits or transit stays. With a little more focus on upkeep and food quality, this hotel can do much better.

text.text:
Vestin Park Hotel is a comfortable and centrally located stay option in the heart of Chennai. Situated close to Egmore and major landmarks like Express Avenue and Marina Beach, it’s ideal for both business travelers and tourists.

The rooms are clean, spacious, and well-equipped with modern amenities including Wi-Fi, air conditioning, and 24-hour room service. The staff is courteous and professional, always attentive to guest needs and quick to assist.

One of the highlights is the in-house restaurant — Galaxy — which serves a good variety of Indian and continental dishes. The breakfast buffet is especially satisfying, offering both local and international options.

Overall, Vestin Park Hotel offers good value for money with great location, quality service, and a comfortable atmosphere. A reliable choice for a short or extended stay in Chennai.

Excellent Stay at Hotel Bhimas Inn, Chennai!

I had a great experience staying at Hotel Bhimas Inn in Chennai. The hotel was clean, comfortable, and very well maintained. The staff were incredibly courteous and helpful, always ready to assist with a smile.

The location is very convenient, especially for travelers—it's close to Chennai Central Railway Station and well connected to other parts of the city. My room was neat and had everything I needed for a comfortable stay.

The check-in and check-out process was smooth, and I felt safe and well taken care of throughout my visit. Overall, I was very satisfied and would definitely recommend Hotel Bhimas Inn to anyone looking for a budget-friendly and reliable place to stay in Chennai.

Spcl Thanks to Jayashree Mam

text.text:
Location is near railway station so good in a way. The day we checked in we had requested for a higher floor room but they put us on the ground floor with a promise they will shift us. This room was cleaned in a hurry so okayish and like all rooms close to reception, it was noisy. We had to follow up with them all day as they kept saying no room free 24 hr checkout and so on and eventually we shifted at 10 pm at night which was not so convenient. The old man at the reception was rude. Construction going in side building so that side rooms will feel stones and building material constantly falling on their windows.

Higher floor room was nice. The windows of this hotel aren't much useful as blocked by buildings on all sides. Mostly cleaning was good except last day when we have keys and left and cleaning was not done. Then someone not from the housekeeping staff came and cleaned. This was frustrating and wasted time. Mistakes happen though.

They didn't want us to book online but didn't want to give the online price either. The guy at the reception spoke a lot repeatedly and kept saying 1700 we give for one person. That day room price was 1600 online. Eventually he said tomorrow if the online price is 2400 you pay that if today online price. To which we agreed.

The weirdest part was that while leaving they started giving us 200 rupees to not mention anything in the review. That was so bad. They are all working hard but can be more polite, tell the truth, and make sure cleaning is done well. Try not to buy your reviews!

That day room price was 1600 online. Eventually he said tomorrow if the online price is 2400 you pay that if today online price. To which we agreed.

The weirdest part was that while leaving they started giving us 200 rupees to not mention anything in the review. That was so bad. They are all working hard but can be more polite, tell the truth, and make sure cleaning is done well. Try not to buy your reviews!

text.text:
There are no complaints about the staff or service, but the rooms and bathrooms need to be maintained better.

Specifically, they are masking odors with strong fragrances in the bathrooms instead of actually cleaning the floors and toilet bowls. The toilet bowls are stained yellow, and there is no ventilation. They must install exhaust fans in the bathroom windows to eliminate unwanted smells. Room service was good, but the room boys communication was poor.

I paid ₹2190 through (MMT) for a standard double bed, but you can get the same room for ₹2000 if you book directly. While the price difference isn't significant, I don't understand why they encourage offline bookings over online ones, as the rates are essentially the same.

You can book this hotel if you have business in Periyamet or the area surrounding the Central Railway Station without any doubt. Other hotels in this area have issues with the smell of urine on their exterior walls and poor service.

My suggestion if they add breakfast option so it's very helpful.

text.text:
I had an excellent stay at Taz Kamar Inn in Chennai. The hotel is located in the heart of T. Nagar, making it very convenient for shopping and getting around the city. Despite the busy area, the hotel itself is calm, clean, and well-maintained.

The room was spacious, neat, and equipped with everything needed for a comfortable stay. The facilities are modern and well-kept, and I truly appreciated the attention to cleanliness throughout the property.

What really made the experience special was the hospitality of the staff. Everyone was very kind, respectful, and attentive. A special thanks to Mr. Abdul Rauf, who went out of his way to make sure all our needs were taken care of. His helpful attitude, professionalism, and warm nature truly stood out and made our stay even more memorable.

Overall, I highly recommend Taz Kamar Inn to anyone visiting Chennai. Whether you’re here for shopping, business, or family visits, this hotel offers great comfort, value, and excellent service.

text.text: Our group stayed at room 202, 205 & 207. The standard of the rooms were atrocious. The towels were very dirty, had numerous stains and was brownish instead of white due to old age. The soap dispenser was faulty and the replacement never came even after requesting. The room service personnel were requested to clean and replace the towels and water bottles. However, they constantly did not replace these items. Furthermore, the Front Office Manager Mr Riyas was extremely rude and impolite when Ms Mahalechumi spoke with him over the phone. On the final day we checked out at 6am and when we requested for a discount since we were checking out almost half a day before the usual check out time and weren’t even taking breakfast, they denied a discount although the previous day we were told that there would be a discount. We are very disappointed with the quality of service and standard.

text.text:
Clean, Comfortable & Courteous Service
My recent stay at this Chennai hotel was very positive, largely due to the exceptional service at reception. While there was a brief 15-minute wait for our room to be ready during check-in, the way the situation was handled by the Ma'am at reception made all the difference.

She was incredibly polite, professional, and provided instructions very clearly. Her explanation for the short delay was transparent and delivered with such courtesy that it completely avoided any disappointment on our part. This level of communication and customer care is truly commendable.

Furthermore, the rooms were clean and comfortable, exactly as expected. Everything we needed for a pleasant stay was provided.

Overall, I highly recommend this hotel. The cleanliness is top-notch, but it's the attitude and professionalism of all the staffs, especially the reception Ma'am, that truly sets this place apart. She turned a potential minor hiccup into a demonstration of excellent service. We left very satisfied and would definitely stay here again.

text.text:
It was an excellent experience staying there. To be honest, initially as we reached the hotel, we felt that the roads were busy and slightly narrow and the rooms were smaller to what we expected. But the staffs were friendly and very welcoming. They addressed our problems and always attended to it as early as possible. Special thanks to Mr. Santhanam who showed extra care. It was an 8 days stay with a 6 month old child and we enjoyed our stay there. Definitely will go to supremestay if I’m traveling again to Chennai. The location is also good.
The road is also quite okay compared to certain roads I saw in Chennai.
I would recommend to book either a triple room or a quadruple room for that extra space. Otherwise, everything else was really good. Thank you supreme stay for giving us a wonderful experience.

I recently stayed at Ginger Hotel Chennai with my family, and it was a delightful experience. The hotel offers excellent value for money, making it an ideal choice for budget-conscious travelers.

Accommodation:
The rooms are compact yet efficiently designed, providing all the necessary amenities for a comfortable stay. They were clean and well-maintained, ensuring a pleasant environment for relaxation.

Staff and Service:
The staff at Ginger Hotel were exceptionally courteous and always ready to assist, regardless of the time. Their dedication to guest satisfaction was evident throughout our stay. Notably, traveling with my young daughter, I appreciated their willingness to provide food whenever she felt hungry, showcasing their commitment to accommodating guests’ needs.

Dining:
The hotel’s dining options were commendable, offering a variety of dishes that catered to different palates. The food was delicious, and the service was prompt.

Overall Experience:
Our family stay at Ginger Hotel Chennai was comfortable and enjoyable. The combination of budget-friendly pricing, efficient room design, and outstanding service makes it a top recommendation for families visiting Chennai.

text.text:
If I could give 0 stars, I absolutely would. This is hands down the worst hotel I’ve ever experienced in all my travels.

First of all, the location is horrible—situated on one of the smelliest roads in Chennai, and that stench carries throughout the entire hotel. The moment you step in, you’re hit with an unbearable odor.

The room was a nightmare: stale, musty smell, dirty linen, torn wallpaper, and an unclean toilet. To make it worse, staff members seem to be using guest room toilets themselves, which is beyond unprofessional and unhygienic.

The service was just as disappointing. Most of the staff were North Indian and completely unhelpful. We paid ₹3000 upon check-in, entered the room, stayed barely 10 minutes, and immediately asked for a refund due to the filth. They refused and only after creating a scene did they finally return our money.

I wouldn’t recommend this hotel to anyone—not even for a short stay. Avoid at all costs.

text.text:
Although the hotel's appearance and entrance are attractive, the rooms carry a different message.

Neither of the two corner rooms I was given had a working television.  It was hard to unwind because of the strong, unpleasant smell in the restrooms and rooms.  The bed linens were old and dirty, and the air conditioner was leaking water, which made things worse.  Though the exterior might create the impression of quality, the internal conditions reveal a lack of cleanliness and upkeep. Don't believe in amenities offered.

Only positive is polite attitude of staff members.

text.text:
Wow – where do I even begin? This stay was absolutely amazing from start to finish! I honestly didn’t expect to feel this comfortable and pampered on a trip.

The room was spotless. Every day it felt like walking into a freshly made space. The attention to detail in the cleaning was next level.

What truly blew me away was the dress washing and ironing service – so professional, fast, and just incredibly helpful. I didn’t have to worry about a thing!

And the room boys… they were honestly the sweetest and most respectful people I’ve met at any hotel. So polite, so helpful – they made everything feel easy and welcoming.

You can even order food through them, and it’s delivered right to your room – super convenient, especially after a long day.

I felt completely taken care of – not like a guest, but like family. 💛
If I could give more than 5 stars, I would! I can’t wait to come back!

text.text:
I had a very disappointing experience at this hotel. We paid for 3 people, but the room provided was extremely small and could barely accommodate 2. There was only one queen-size bed, and when we asked for extra bedding, they gave only a single mattress without even a bedsheet. The toilet was broken, and the room was not properly cleaned.

The room service was the worst part — every request took almost an hour, which is unacceptable for any hotel. Overall, the service and facilities were far below basic expectations.

This place is completely misleading and feels like a fraud. Please don’t book this hotel — save your money and avoid the hassle.

text.text:
I had a wonderful experience staying at The Grand One Hotel. The location is extremely convenient, especially for those visiting Apollo Hospital, as it’s just a short walk away. The rooms were spotlessly clean, well-maintained, and equipped with all the basic amenities needed for a comfortable stay.

What truly stood out was the hospitality of the staff—they were polite, helpful, and always ready to assist with a smile. The check-in process was smooth, and housekeeping was prompt and efficient. Even though the hotel doesn’t have an in-house restaurant, room service was available and there were plenty of dining options nearby.

The hotel also offers free Wi-Fi, 24-hour front desk support, and ample parking space, which added to the convenience. I would highly recommend The Grand One to anyone looking for a clean, budget-friendly, and centrally located stay in Chennai.

text.text: Myself & my wife went to Chennai on 13 May 2023 till 26 May, stayed at Grand One Tower ( GOT). A newly built resort cum hotel ( still under construction). Room are tidy & well maintained with affordable range. Located in one of the Posh area of Chennai, only 2/ 3 minutes walk to Apollo Hospital. Daily housekeeping available with very nice staffs. Specially Worth mentioning Maneger Mr Mustaque. He was always available with ☺. My suggestion is that, they must complete restaurant facilities which under renovation immediately.  Authorities must provide bottles of drinking water including complementary tea/ coffee arrangement in the rooms. We enjoyed our stay at GOT!!!

text.text:
A Perfect Blend of Food, Location, and Hospitality

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Vestin Park, Chennai, and I must say, it was an experience worth every penny. This hotel truly stands out for its exceptional food, prime location, and outstanding hospitality.

Food:
The culinary offerings at Vestin Park, Chennai are nothing short of spectacular. The breakfast buffet was a delightful spread of fresh fruits, pastries, and hot dishes catering to both international and local tastes. I particularly enjoyed the Idly Sambar. The in-house restaurant offers a diverse menu, and every meal felt like it was crafted with care and attention to detail.

Location:
Situated in the heart of , the hotel's location is unbeatable.Transportation is a breeze, with easy access to public transit and ample parking for those driving. Whether you're here for business or leisure, the location ensures convenience and plenty of exploration opportunities.

Hospitality:
The staff at Vestin Park, Chennai deserve a special mention. From the warm welcome at check-in to the attentive service throughout my stay, they truly made me feel at home. Every request was met with a smile, and they went above and beyond to ensure my comfort. I was particularly impressed by their local knowledge and recommendations, which made my trip even more memorable.

Overall:
Vestin Park, Chennai exceeded my expectations in every way. If you're looking for a hotel that combines delectable food, a prime location, and unmatched hospitality, look no further. I can't wait to return and highly recommend it to anyone visiting Chennai.

Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

text.text:
I recently srtayed at KTDC Raindrops in Chennai for a long duration and had a fairly comfortable experience overall. The hotel's central location on Greams Road was extremely convenient, especially being close to Apollo Hospital, major business areas, and easy access to other parts of the city. It made getting around smooth and hassle-free.

During my extended stay, I found the rooms to be consistently spacious and comfortable. The bed was cozy, and the room had all the basic amenities like air conditioning, a television, and Wi-Fi. However, the interiors do feel a bit dated, and a few maintenance issues came up occasionally, like a musty smell or slightly worn-out bathroom fittings. These weren’t major problems but could use improvement for better comfort during longer stays.

The restaurant serves a good range of dishes, with a strong emphasis on Kerala cuisine, which I enjoyed. The breakfast buffet, while not very elaborate, was satisfying and had a decent variety. On a few days, I found the food could’ve been a bit fresher or hotter, but the staff were generally quick to respond to any feedback.

The hotel staff were friendly and helpful throughout my stay. Their consistent support—whether it was with laundry, room service, or general assistance—made a big difference over time. I appreciated their professionalism and willingness to accommodate special requests when needed.

Overall, my long stay at KTDC Raindrops was comfortable and practical. It's a solid mid-range option in Chennai, particularly suitable for those looking for a good location, decent facilities, and polite service over an extended period. With some updates and deeper maintenance, it could offer an even better experience.

originalText.text: This Hotel is located exactly opposite to the Egmore railway station. Firstly, rooms are good but shower pipe accessories are not worked and it is not clean. In addition, the upvc window, which I had stayed in the 4th floor room, don't have any safety grill. When you open the window you can see you're standing above the big tree level. This might be a safety risk for children and unstable mindset peoples. Next, we need to order food from the below restaurant, they will deliver to your room and we need to pay at the moment.
